Comment.Language: He censes toward the west, saying:

Text.Language: <ere p~,oroc n~te niaggeloc: nem na[oic n~io] n~a~poctoloc: nem p~,oroc n~te nimarturoc: nem n/eyouab t/rou.
Hail to the choir of the angels, to my masters and fathers the apostles, and to the choir of the martyrs and all the saints.

Comment.Language: He censes toward the south, saying:

Text.Language: <ere Iwann/c p~s/ri n~Za,ariac: ,ere piou/b p~s/ri m~piou/b.
Hail to John, the son of Zacharias. Hail to the priest, the son of the priest.

Comment.Language: He censes toward the East, saying:

Text.Language: Marenouwst m~pencwt/r: pimairwmi n~a~gayoc: je n~yof afsenh/t qaron afi~ ouoh afcw] m~mon.
Let us worship our Savior, the Good One and Lover of Mankind, for He had compassion on us and has come and saved us.
